structure.unit: ARTICLE CXXVIII. MIAMI-DADE COUNTY COMMUNITY PERIODICAL ADVERTISING PROGRAM

text.section:
Sec. 2-2015. Applications.
To participate, a periodical must submit an application in a form prepared by Miami-Dade County. The application will contain separate sections addressing each of the required qualifications of the program. At a minimum, the application form will require the following documents to be attached to the application: a current issue, printer's invoices, valid occupational license, proof of registration as a vendor with Miami-Dade County, rate card, business documents reflecting ownership, for example, articles of incorporation or partnership agreement. No submitted application will be complete without such documents. In addition, prior to admitting a periodical to the program, the administration will confirm the publication history by reviewing all issues published in the prior three years as required by subsection(k). The application must be signed and notarized by an owner or officer of the periodical. The Miami-Dade County may require the applicant to file the application in person or to participate in an application review meeting. All Community Periodicals intending to participate in the program must submit new applications pursuant to this ordinance.
